Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] heritrix-3.0.0-beta better than its final release?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Qz7BRfQRVIqjKB5KEmvFF8GSKgLamHwA-eM1V9ecYcbi
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

There's no known problems that could explain this behavior, but it's 
possible that some of the refactoring -- especially around checkpointing 
-- rearranged the processing-chains so that a configuration from earlier 
H3 test releases needs adaptation.

My usual recommendation in such cases is to build up a working 
configuration from the bundled defaults in the current release -- 
copying/porting your unique settings one-by-one, to make sure they make 
sense in the context of the new model configuration.

If that doesn't help, are there any other patterns to the URIs that you 
do get in the problematic (final release) crawls -- are they only your 
seeds, or only one-hop from seeds, for example?

- Gordon @ IA

Pranay Pandey wrote:
> 
> 
> 
> Hi,
> 
> I had been crawling regularly few sites using H3-beta and I was able to 
> crawl them satisfactorily in all my attempts.
> With H-3.0 final release (dec 11) version, with the 'exactly' same 
> crawler-beans settings as used with H3-beta, I am unable to crawl those 
> sites now.
> I am noticing that the 'discovered or queued URIs'  doesn't grow beyond 
> 1k or so and crawl finishes within few minutes. With beta, I could see 
> millions of URIs discovered and crawl with exactly the same settings.
> I am not a heritrix developer. People who worked on the beta and the 
> final release: any clue what (modules) underwent changes that possibly 
> could affect the uri discovery?
> 
> Thanks!
> Pranay
> 
> 
> 
>
